fields.name: Easy
fields.description: This should be easy to decipher. It was encrypted using a shift cipher of one to the right

fields.name: A Bit Harder
fields.description: For a little bit more of a challenge, this was encrypted using a shift cipher of two to the left

fields.name: Halfway There
fields.description: Rot-13 shift ciphers are interesting because the same cipher is used for encrypting and decrypting

fields.name: Switching Things Up
fields.description: This time, you are given a message and need to encrypt it using a shift cipher of 4 to the right.

fields.name: Hello, Caesar
fields.description: Julius Caesar used a shift cipher of -3 to encrypt messages. This message is the first challenge, but Caesar's last words (translated to English).

fields.name: A Prime Challenge
fields.description: This message was encrypted using a shift cipher. The characters were shifted by the product of the first two positive prime numbers, two and three.

fields.name: A Real Sentence
fields.description: The number of words in the message is the same as the amount of shift used to encrypt it. Of course, once you've decrypted one, you've decrypted them all.
fields.encrypted: JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW JCNNITW
fields.decrypted: BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO
